gurmukhi: sunI eym bwnI sIAw Drm DwmM ]ricXo eyk bwgM mhwN ABrwmM ]
transliteration: Souniem Baaniseeaa Dharam Dhamannd|| Rachiyo Ek Baagadg Mahaan Achraamannd||
translation: Listening to the orders of Ram, the abode of Dharma, a very beautiful garden was created;

gurmukhi: mxI BUiKqM hIr cIrM AnMqM ]lKy ieMdR p`QM ljy sRoB vMqM ]
transliteration: Manibhookhitan Heer Chderan Anantan|| Lakhe Indra Patthan Laje Srobh Vantan||718||
translation: That garden looked like one bedecked with gems and diamonds and before which the forest of Indra felt shy.718.

gurmukhi: mxI mwl bjRM ssoBwid mwnM ]sBY dyv dyvM duqI surg jwnM ]
transliteration: Manimaal Bajran Sasobhaae Maanan|| Sabhai Dev Devan Doutisurag Jaanan||
translation: It was thus decorated with jewels, wreaths and diamonds that all the gods had considered it as a second heaven.

gurmukhi: gey rwm qw mo sIAw sMg lIny ]ikqI kot suMdrI sBY sMig kIny ]719]
transliteration: Gad Raam Taa Mo Seeaa San Leene|| Kitikot Soundarisabhai San(i) Keene||719||
translation: Ram Chander went to abide there with Sita and many beautiful women.719.

gurmukhi: rcXo eyk mMdRM mhw suBR TwmM ]krXo rwm sYnM qhwN Drm DwmM ]
transliteration: Rachyo Ek Mandran Mahaa Soubhra Thaamannd|| Daryo Raam Sainan Tahaan Dharam Dhaamannd||
translation: A beautiful palace was built there where Ram, the abode of Dharma,

gurmukhi: krI kyl KylM su bylM su bylM su BogM ]huqo jaun kwlM smY jYs jogM ]720]
transliteration: Karikel Khelan Su Belag Su Bhogadg|| Houto Jaoun Kaalan Samai Jais Jouang||720||
translation: Used to sleep and enjoyed at different times in various ways.720.

gurmukhi: rhXo sIA grBM sunXo srb bwmM ]khy eym sIqw punr bYn rwmM ]
transliteration: Rahyo Seeaa Gadabhan Sounyo Sarab Baamannd|| Kahe Em Seetaa Pounar Bain Raamannd||
translation: After sometimes all the women heard that Sita was pregnant, then Sita said to Ram :

gurmukhi: iPrXo bwg bwgM ibdw nwQ dIjY ]suno pRwn ipAwry iehY kwj kIjY ]721]
transliteration: Phiryo Baag Baagadg Bidaa Naath Deeji|| Souno Praan Pidare Ihai Kaaj Keejai||721||
translation: â€œI have wandered enough in this forest, O my lord, bid me farewell.721.

gurmukhi: dIXO rwm sMgM suimqRw kumwrM ]deI jwnkI sMg qw ky suDwrM ]
transliteration: Deeyau Raam Sanadg Soumitraa Kkoumaaran|| Daijaanakisan Taa Ke Sudhaaran||

gurmukhi: jhwN Gor swlM qmwlM ibkRwlM ]qhwN sIA ko Cor AwieXo auqwlM ]722]
transliteration: Jahaan Ghor Saalan Tamaalan Bikraalan|| Tahaan Seea Ko Chhodh Aaiyo Outaalan||722||
translation: Lakshman left her in the Vihar forest, where there were lawful trees of saal and tamaal.722.

gurmukhi: bnM inrjnM dyK kY kY ApwrM ]bnMbws jwnXo dXo rwvxwrM ]
transliteration: Banan Nirjanan Dekh Kai Kai Apaaran|| Bananbaas Jaanyo Dayo Raavanaaran||
translation: Finding herself in a desolate forest, Sita understood that Ram had exiled her;

gurmukhi: rurodM sur au`cM ppwqMq pRwnM ]rxM jym vIrM lgy mrm bwmM ]723]
transliteration: Rurodan Sur Ouchchannd Papaatant Praanan|| Ranan Jem Vderan Lage Maram Beeman||723||
translation: There she began to weep in a fatal sound in a loud voice like a warrior being shot by an arrow on the secret parts.723.

gurmukhi: sunI bwlmIkM sRuqM dIn bwnI ]clXo kauk ic`qM qjI mon DwnI ]
transliteration: Sounibaalmeekan Sroutan Deen Baanee|| Chadyo Kaouk Chittan Tahimon Dhaanee||
translation: The sage Valmiki heard this voice and forsaking his silence and shouting in wonder went towards Sita;

gurmukhi: sIAw sMig lIny gXo Dwm AwpM ]mno b`c krmM durgw jwp jwpM ]724]
transliteration: Seeaa San(i) Leene Gado Dhaam Aapan|| Mano Bachch Karamannd Durgad Jaap Jaapan||724||
translation: He returned to his home alongwith Sita repeating the name of Sruga with mind, speech and action.724.
